results.title: Continent in crisis
results.creator_credit: David Smith, Malcolm Paterson and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The Australian environment is in severe ecological crisis with soil degradation, salinity and deforestation all taking their toll on the land. But it is not all doom and gloom. Through satellite technology using remote sensing and computer analysis, scientists are able to plot the landscape on a daily, even hourly, basis and chart such occurrences as bushfires, floods, vegetation regrowth etc. This allows for future planning both environmentally and economically. “Continent in crisis” is a celebration of Australia’s natural beauty from the red centre, to the rainforests to the Great Barrier Reef and of the world-ranking environmental research being undertaken by CSIRO and others.

results.title: Cosmic zoom
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Probes the infinite magnitude of space, and its reverse, the ultimate minuteness of matter. Animation art and animation camera achieve this journey to the farthest conceivable point of the universe and then into the tiniest particle of existence - an atom of a living cell - with freshness and clarity that would seem impossible with other means of exposition. (Awards: Bilbao, Buenos Aires, Philadelphia, Berlin)

results.title: Bilingualism
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A close view of a wide-open management’s handling of a problem with parallels far beyond the borders of Quebec. How Steinberg Ltd comes to grips with one of the major challenges it faces - the bilingual, bicultural nature of the Quebec society in which it functions - is seen, as top and middle management pursue a policy on the issues. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: Growth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A hand-cart and bicycle, then a delivery wagon and a horse - Sam Steinberg reminisces over the fifty years of his company’s growth into a large, diversified corporation. A company cannot stand still, it must go forward he claims. In this film you see the process continuing as corporation executives meet to consider interrelated operations, projects and priorities. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: International operations
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
The arrival of Steinberg’s French affiliate, Supermarches Montreal, on the outskirts of Paris is viewed here from the point of its cultural effects: the impact of the supermarket on the shopping and eating habits of the French; and the problems of adjustment by store employees, by Paris shoppers, and by local merchants who see their customers drift away. As Sam Steinberg makes his first visit to the French stores, many of these problems are seen at first hand. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: Contact [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Steve Starkey and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The search for life outside our solar system becomes a personal and spiritual quest for Ellie Arroway, a scientist who has lost her faith in God after her parents died when she was a child. However, she has learned to develop a different sort of faith in the seemingly unknowable, working with a group that monitors radio waves from space in a hope that some day she will receive a message from another world- proving there is a world beyond our own. When the team picks up a signal that does not appear to be of earthly origin, Ellie decodes the message and discovers what appear to be plans for a space craft, which she takes as an invitation. Ellie and her researchers soon run into interference however from a White House scientific adviser who cuts their funding and tries to take credit for their achievements. Cast includes Jodie Foster, Matthew McConaughey, James Woods, John Hurt and Tom Skerritt.

results.title: Consumer power
results.creator_credit: Peita Bolden and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Four fifteen minute programs which follow Anna, Nick and skeleton Clive as they set up a toy shop and in the process learn to cope with the minefield of choices and responsibilities facing young consumers. An engaging and humourous story unfolds to assist 7-10 year olds in learning about consumer expectations, advertising, budgeting and consumer rights and responsibilities.

results.title: Corduroy
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Joe Mantegna, Evergreen/Firehouse Productions and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The film follows the adventures of a stuffed teddy bear called Corduroy who waits to be selected from the shelves of a department store. To make sure he is not mistaken for used property, he embarks on a quest to find a button that is missing from his overalls. In the process, he discovers a new and deserving owner. Based on the the book by Don Freeman.

results.title: Coral sea dreaming: an evolving balance
results.creator_credit: David Hannan, Ian O'Hare, Coral Sea Imagery and Natural Symphonies
results.brief_description: Coral Sea dreaming is a remarkable visual and musical odyssey into the world of coral reefs. The haunting and magical experiences of the reef realm are communicated through the camera work of David Hannan who teamed with scientist Russell Kelly and artist Cathy Bone to present their “dreaming”. The video is without words, but with a specially composed musical score by Adelaide composer Tania Rose. Scientific understanding begins in seeing. “Coral Sea dreaming” lets you see for yourself, lets you be the explorer. Accompanied by an educational and resource guide.
